verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician, <WH5329> Altaschith, <WH516> Michtam <WH4387> of David. <WH1732> Do you indeed <WH552> speak <WH1696> righteousness, <WH6664> O congregation? <WH482> do you judge <WH8199> uprightly, <WH4339> O you sons <WH1121> of men? <WH120>
Yes, <WH637> in heart <WH3820> you work <WH6466> wickedness; <WH5766> you weigh <WH6424> the violence <WH2555> of your hands <WH3027> in the earth. <WH776>
The wicked <WH7563> are estranged <WH2114> from the womb: <WH7358> they go <WH8582> astray <WH8582> as soon as they be born, <WH990> speaking <WH1696> lies. <WH3576>
Their poison <WH2534> is like <WH1823> the poison <WH2534> of a serpent: <WH5175> they are like <WH3644> the deaf <WH2795> adder <WH6620> that stops <WH331> her ear; <WH241>
Which <WH834> will not listen <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of charmers, <WH3907> charming <WH2266> <WH2267> never so wisely. <WH2449>
Break <WH2040> their teeth, <WH8127> O God, <WH430> in their mouth: <WH6310> break <WH5422> out the great <WH4459> teeth <WH4973> of the young <WH3715> lions, <WH3715> O LORD. <WH3068>
Let them melt <WH3988> away as waters <WH4325> which run <WH1980> continually: when he bends <WH1869> his bow to shoot his arrows, <WH2671> let them be as cut <WH4135> in pieces.
As a snail <WH7642> which melts, <WH8557> let every one of them pass <WH1980> away: like the untimely <WH5309> birth <WH5309> of a woman, <WH802> that they may not see <WH2372> the sun. <WH8121>
Before <WH2962> your pots <WH5518> can feel <WH995> the thorns, <WH329> he shall take <WH8175> them away as with a whirlwind, <WH8175> both living, <WH2416> and in his wrath. <WH2740>
The righteous <WH6662> shall rejoice <WH8055> when <WH3588> he sees <WH2372> the vengeance: <WH5359> he shall wash <WH7364> his feet <WH6471> in the blood <WH1818> of the wicked. <WH7563>
So that a man <WH120> shall say, <WH559> Truly <WH389> there is a reward <WH6529> for the righteous: <WH6662> truly <WH389> he is a God <WH430> that judges <WH8199> in the earth. <WH776>
